Trial_Design.evidence: The Prehospital Air Medical Plasma (PAMPer) trial randomized severely injured patients (n=501)

Intervention.evidence: randomized severely injured patients (n=501) to receive either standard care (crystalloid) or two units of prehospital plasma followed by standard care fluid resuscitation

Objective.evidence: We sought to characterize the unexpected survivors, patients who survived despite having high predicted mortality following traumatic injury.

Method_Outcome.evidence: We defined unexpected survivors as patients who had a predicted mortality >50% and survived to 30 days.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Unexpected survivors who received prehospital plasma had a lower observed to expected mortality than those that received standard care resuscitation (O/E 0.56 [0.33–0.84] vs. 1.0 [0.73–1.32]).
